verb.description: Give reasons or cite evidence in support of an idea, action, or theory, typically with the aim of persuading others to share one's view.
examples: defense attorneys argue that the police lacked “probable cause” to arrest the driver

verb.description: Exchange or express diverging or opposite views, typically in a heated or angry way.
examples: I wasn't going to argue with a gun
she was too tired to argue the point

origin: Middle English: from Old French arguer, from Latin argutari prattle, frequentative of arguere make clear, prove, accuse.
